summary: This document is a chain of custody log from the Federal Bureau of Prisons, detailing the seizure and handling of two computers (items NYM-19-00185 and NYM-19-00184) on August 11, 2019. The evidence was designated for FBI analysis, indicating it was part of an ongoing investigation, likely related to Jeffrey Epstein's case following his death.

events.title: Seizure of Computers from MCC
events.description: Two computers were seized as evidence from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
keyFacts: Two computers were seized as evidence from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 11, 2019.
The evidence custody documents indicate the items were designated for FBI analysis.
The seizure date (August 11, 2019) is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, suggesting these items were part of the post-mortem investigation.
The document is a standard DOJ/FBP chain of custody form, showing procedural handling of evidence.
No named individuals are listed in the provided text; all name fields for witnesses and handlers are blank or not filled in.
